Last night, the workers at Sunset Station Hotel & Casino overwhelmingly stood together to demand fair wages, fair benefits and fair treatment on the job. I congratulate these workers and @Culinary226 on another hard-earned victory for workers' rights. https://twitter.com/Culinary226/status/1139382070122184704 QT @Culinary226 🚨BREAKING: Workers at @stationcasinos @SunsetStation_ unionize! 
437 workers voted and 83% voted “YES” for the union. 

Approximately 600 Sunset Station workers will be represented by the Culinary and Bartenders Unions.

https://www.culinaryunion226.org/news/press/workers-at-station-casinos-sunset-station-unionize http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D8_lqh8UIAE5BXD.jpg

As president, I will launch a $7 billion Small Business Equity Fund to provide grants to entrepreneurs—not loans or loan guarantees. Loans aren’t as good as equity because they leave businesses with debt when they’re trying to grow. Equity helps businesses thrive from the start.

When women's reproductive rights are under attack, we have to fight to ensure access to reproductive health care—and that includes contraception.
 
My colleagues and I introduced a bill to expand access to over-the-counter birth control and make it more affordable.

Everyone deserves access to safe, affordable, and comprehensive reproductive health care and we won’t stop fighting to defend that right.
https://twitter.com/PramilaJayapal/status/1139248451466739713 QT @PramilaJayapal I have never spoken publicly about my abortion. That disparity in startup capital is creating a small business gap that costs us millions of jobs & billions in economic growth. And it's another example of how the racial wealth gap in America hurts Black, Latinx, Native American, and other minority families & communities.

If you have good ideas and work hard, you should be able to build a small business and make a living. Black and Brown entrepreneurs are held back by a start-up capital gap that makes it harder to start and grow their business. I've got a plan to fix that. https://www.blackenterprise.com/exclusive-elizabeth-warren-level-the-playing-field-for-black-entrepreneurs/

It's time for a 21st Century Economic Bill of Rights:

- The right to a decent job with a living wage
- The right to quality health care
- The right to a complete education
- The right to affordable housing
- The right to a clean environment
- The right to a secure retirement
